comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: The TriMotor has the British mark G-, c/n 60 was G-ABHO based at Heston, Comper Swift G-AAZF was based at Heston, near London....but it has been suggested that this is at Hooton Park, then the airport for Liverpool, UK.The earliest Fords in the UK were assembled in the Comper hangars at Hooton where these Comper Swifts were built Same photo in Flight see www.flightglobal.com/pdfarchive/view/1930/untitled0%20-%2...
